asyouareboudoir: Such an accurate description of sadness. Thank you for sharing everything with us.♥️
andrea.fairservice: Jen you have no idea how helpful these posts are for me to understand me better and make me reflect on my own experiences and emotions. But at the same time I feel so much for you I know I’m just a stranger but I want to fix it so bad. Maybe we’re both fixers? I don’t know you personally and so naturally I feel like I’m not qualified to give advice but I also can’t help but to think about all of the incredibly hard, and (seemingly) unfamiliar work you’ve been doing for what seems like a better part of a year. I’m talking your podcast and now your book. From what I’ve seen from a silly social media app it looks like your book has consumed and uprooted you so much from your daily life, a life/routine in which you’ve worked so hard to sort out so you can feel more balance regularly. You’ve done things maybe you wouldn’t have done if you weren’t all in for the book. I’m not saying those things you’ve done are wrong, or signing up for the book was wrong, I’m just wondering if this is the response your body is having after you worked so long to find a more sustainable 7.8 and then you chose to add these other challenges in that your brain and body don’t know how to handle so you’ve felt a ton of overwhelm? I hope you feel very proud of ALL of the work you’ve done, both for your mental health, and for your career and to advocate for others with mental health hurdles. Maybe this is your brain releasing all of the stress and confusion and overwhelm it’s felt these past months from the challenges you accepted and it’s just now feeling like it can let it out? Ugh this is so long winded, I’m sorry. Maybe try to let your feelings be your feelings. You said you don’t think it’s depression. Maybe you don’t have to do anything but have your cry or your scream in your car because they want to be set free. Set the anger and the sad free and maybe soon you will feel lighter again. Maybe don’t try to fix? Maybe this is your body’s way of “fixing” itself? I’m so sorry for the long winded comment. I wish I could really help! Xoxo enjoy those donuts lady. You’ll balance out again. 💘

darlybird: Sometimes it’s the hardest to let ourselves be sad when we know that there are “fixes” like mindfulness, exercise, meditation, breathing....in one of my very saddest moments post-divorce, post-breakup, I felt instructed internally to lean into the sadness. Not try and fix it through my “enlightened” methods. Let it wash over me and over me and over me and through me again and again. I remember telling my mom that I was going through a “spiritual death” one weekend and she begged me to come to her house to be safe. 😂 I knew there was nothing to fear inside the sadness and that feeling it was the first step out. And it was. And I survived. And I find that 5 years out from that shitty divorce (that almost did me completely in) that those waves still come. There sometimes are no answers. Wine and donuts are a good start. 😘
